title: Very yummy pork spare ribs
ingredients:
600g pork spare ribs
lots of garlic mashed
MARINADE
1 tspn cornflour
1 tspn salt
1 tspn sugar
1 tspn five-spice powder
1 tblspn sherry
1 tbspn satay sauce
1 tbspn peanut butter
1 tbspn oil
1 egg
SAUCE
6 tbspn tomato sauce
100g brown sugar
2 tbspn black vinegar
1 tspn salt
1 tbspn lemon juice
2 cups hot water
method: Rub the spare ribs all over with the mashed garlic.
Then combine all the marinade ingredients and rub well into the meat.
Leave for at least an hour before grilling in an oven or better still in your barbecue to get a hint of smoke to the meat.
Itâ€™s even better if you marinate the meat in an air-tight container in the fridge overnight.
For the sauce, mix all ingredients together and bring to the boil, add the  ribs, cover and simmer over a low heat until the ribs are moist and well-coated with sauce (about 15 minutes).
Serve with the sauce ladled over the ribs . . . some finely sliced shallots sprinkled over will make it look and taste even better.
